note.p: Death: His house in Fitzwilliam Street, Cambridge (05 June 1898)
Education: Schools at Beverley and Oakham; Caius College, Cambridge (admitted 1835); migrated to St John's College, Cambridge (1835); Inner Temple (admitted 1839). BA (1839), MA (1842), ScD (1883)

Career: Fellow of St John's College, Cambridge (1839-1841); ordained deacon (1841); ordained priest (1842); Lecturer in Mathematics, Jesus College, Cambridge (1847-1859); Lecturer in Mathematics, King's College, Cambridge (1859-1889); Fellow of King's College, Cambridge (1882-1898); his private pupils included William Kingdon Clifford (FRS 1874); played the piano and painted water colours
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1898-1899 vol 64 pp vii-ix signed by H M T
